result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Antoine Joseph Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles Antoine Joseph Jr. appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Lamke is unavailable for todays proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles Antoine Joseph Jr. appeared by video. Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense Counsel is not present and did not contact the court. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Matthew Lamke
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 8-23-22
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Charles Antoine Joseph in court with attorney Erica N Young.  Defendant Charles Antoine Joseph in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles Antoine Joseph appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
